contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Gushikawa'''|具志川市|Gushikawa-shi|[[Okinawan language|Okinawan]]: ''Gushichan''}} was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Okinawa prefecture|Okinawa]], [[Japan]]. On April 1, 2005 Gushikawa was merged with the towns of [[Katsuren, Okinawa|Katsuren]] and [[Yonashiro, Okinawa|Yonashiro]], both from [[Nakagami District, Okinawa|Nakagami District]], and the old city of [[Ishikawa, Okinawa|Ishikawa]], to form the new city of [[Uruma, Okinawa|Uruma]]. As of 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 62,814 and a total area of 31.99 km², with a [[population density|density]] of 1,963.55 persons per km². ==External links== *[http://www.city.uruma.lg.jp/ Uruma official website] {{Okinawa}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okinawa Prefecture]] {{Okinawa-geo-stub}}
